midas/drivers/bus/hyt1331.c

00001 /********************************************************************
00002 
00003   Name:         hyt1331.c
00004   Created by:   Stefan Ritt
00005 
00006   Contents:     Device driver for HYTEC 1331 Turbo CAMAC controller
00007                 either via IS PC card or via 5331 PCI interface card
00008                 following the MIDAS CAMAC Standard under DIRECTIO
00009

00070 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00071 
00072 #if defined( __MSDOS__ )
00073 #include <dos.h>
00074 #define OUTP(_p, _d) outportb(_p, _d)
00075 #define OUTPW(_p, _d) outport(_p, _d)
00076 #define INP(_p) inportb(_p)
00077 #define INPW(_p) inport(_p)
00078 #define OUTP_P(_p, _d) outportb(_p, _d)
00079 #define OUTPW_P(_p, _d) outport(_p, _d)
00080 #define INP_P(_p) inportb(_p)
00081 #define INPW_P(_p) inport(_p)
00082 #elif defined( _MSC_VER )
00083 #include <windows.h>
00084 #include <conio.h>
00085 #include <signal.h>
00086 #define OUTP(_p, _d) _outp((WORD) (_p), (BYTE) (_d))
00087 #define OUTPW(_p, _d) _outpw((WORD) (_p), (WORD) (_d))
00088 #define OUTPD(_p, _d) _outpd((WORD) (_p), (unsigned int) (_d))
00089 #define INP(_p) _inp((WORD) (_p))
00090 #define INPW(_p) _inpw((WORD) (_p))
00091 #define INPD(_p) _inpd((WORD) (_p))
00092 #define OUTP_P(_p, _d) {_outp((WORD) (_p), (int) (_d)); _outp((WORD)0x80,0);}
00093 #define OUTPW_P(_p, _d) {_outpw((WORD) (_p), (WORD) (_d)); _outp((WORD)0x80,0);}
00094 #define INP_P(_p) _inp((WORD) (_p)); _outp((WORD)0x80,0);
00095 #define INPW_P(_p) _inpw((WORD) (_p));_outp((WORD)0x80,0);
00096 #elif defined( __linux__ )
00097 #if !defined(__OPTIMIZE__)
00098 #error Please compile hyt1331.c with the -O flag to make port access possible
00099 #endif
00100 //#include <asm/io.h>
00101 #include <sys/io.h>
00102 #include <unistd.h>
00103 #include <signal.h>
00104 #define OUTP(_p, _d) outb(_d, _p)
00105 #define OUTPW(_p, _d) outw(_d, _p)
00106 #define INP(_p) inb(_p)
00107 #define INPW(_p) inw(_p)
00108 #define OUTP_P(_p, _d) outb_p(_d, _p)
00109 #define OUTPW_P(_p, _d) outw_p(_d, _p)
00110 #define INP_P(_p) inb_p(_p)
00111 #define INPW_P(_p) inw_p(_p)
00112 #endif

00116 #define MAX_DEVICES 4           /* Maximal 4 PC cards                   */
00117 
00118 WORD io_base[MAX_DEVICES];      /* IO base addrress for PC interfaces   */
00119 BYTE irq[MAX_DEVICES];          /* IRQ for PC interfaces                */
00120 
00121 int gbl_sw1d[MAX_DEVICES];      /* Switch 1D on HYT1331 controlelr      */

00125 INLINE void cam8i(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f, BYTE * d)
00126 {
00127    WORD adr, status;
00128 
00129    adr = io_base[c >> 2] + ((c % 3) << 4);
00130    OUTP(adr + 8, n);
00131    OUTP(adr + 6, a);
00132    OUTP(adr + 10, f);
00133 
00134    status = (BYTE) INP(adr + 6);
00135    *((BYTE *) d) = INP(adr);
00136 }
00137 
00138 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00139 
00140 INLINE void cami(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f, WORD * d)
00141 {
00142    WORD adr, status;
00143 
00144    adr = io_base[c >> 2] + ((c % 3) << 4);
00145    OUTP(adr + 8, n);
00146    OUTP(adr + 6, a);
00147    OUTP(adr + 10, f);
00148 
00149    status = (BYTE) INP(adr + 6);
00150    *((BYTE *) d) = INP(adr);
00151    *(((BYTE *) d) + 1) = INP(adr + 2);
00152 }

00163 INLINE void cam24i(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f, DWORD * d)
00164 {
00165    WORD adr;
00166    BYTE status;
00167 
00168    adr = io_base[c >> 2] + ((c % 3) << 4);
00169    OUTP(adr + 8, n);
00170    OUTP(adr + 6, a);
00171    OUTP(adr + 10, f);
00172 
00173    status = (BYTE) INP(adr + 6);
00174    *((BYTE *) d) = INP(adr);
00175    *(((BYTE *) d) + 1) = INP(adr + 2);
00176    *(((BYTE *) d) + 2) = INP(adr + 4);
00177    *(((BYTE *) d) + 3) = 0;
00178 }

00182 INLINE void cam8i_q(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f,
00183                     BYTE * d, int *x, int *q)
00184 {
00185    WORD adr;
00186    BYTE status;
00187

00189    OUTP(adr + 8, n);
00190    OUTP(adr + 6, a);
00191    OUTP(adr + 10, f);
00192

00194    *((BYTE *) d) = INP(adr);
00195 
00196    *q = status & 1;

00243 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00244 
00245 INLINE void cam16i_r(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f,
00246                      WORD ** d, const int r)
00247 {
00248    WORD adr, i, status;
00249 
00250    adr = io_base[c >> 2] + ((c % 3) << 4);
00251 
00252    OUTP(adr + 8, n);
00253    OUTP(adr + 6, a);
00254    OUTP_P(adr + 10, f);
00255 
00256    status = (BYTE) INP(adr + 6);
00257    *((BYTE *) * d) = INP(adr);
00258    *(((BYTE *) * d) + 1) = INP(adr + 2);        /* read the first word */
00259    (*d)++;
00260 
00261    INPW_P(adr + 12);            /* trigger first cycle */
00262 
00263    for (i = 0; i < (r - 1); i++)
00264       *((*d)++) = INPW(adr + 12);       /* read data and trigger next cycle */
00265 }
00266

00316 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00317 
00318 INLINE void cam16i_rq(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f,
00319                       WORD ** d, const int r)
00320 {
00321    WORD adr, i;
00322    int fail;
00323 
00324    /* following code is disabled by above code */
00325    adr = io_base[c >> 2] + ((c % 3) << 4);
00326 
00327    OUTP(adr + 8, n);
00328    OUTP(adr + 6, a);
00329    /* Turn on the Q-mode for repeat until Q=1 in the INPW(adr+12) */
00330    OUTP(adr + 1, 0x10);
00331    OUTP_P(adr + 10, f);
00332    INPW_P(adr + 12);            /* trigger first cycle */
00333 
00334    for (i = 0; i < r; i++) {
00335       /* read data and trigger next cycle fail = no valid Q within 12usec */
00336       **d = INPW_P(adr + 12);
00337       fail = ((BYTE) INP(adr + 6)) & 0x20;      // going to test!
00338       if (fail)
00339          break;
00340       (*d)++;
00341    }
00342    /* Turn off the Q-mode for repeat until Q=1 in the INPW(adr+12) */
00343    OUTP(adr + 1, 0x0);
00344 }
00345 
00346 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00347 
00348 INLINE void cam24i_rq(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f,
00349                       DWORD ** d, const int r)
00350 {
00351    WORD adr;
00352    int i, fail;
00353 
00354    adr = io_base[c >> 2] + ((c % 3) << 4);
00355 
00356    OUTP(adr + 8, n);
00357    OUTP(adr + 6, a);
00358    /* Turn on the Q-mode for repeat until Q=1 in the INPW(adr+12) */
00359    OUTP(adr + 1, 0x10);
00360    OUTP_P(adr + 10, f);
00361    INPW_P(adr + 12);            /* trigger first cycle */
00362 
00363    for (i = 0; i < r; i++) {
00364       /* read data and trigger next cycle fail = no valid Q within 12usec */
00365       *(((BYTE *) * d) + 2) = INP(adr + 4);
00366       *(((BYTE *) * d) + 3) = 0;
00367       *((WORD *) * d) = INPW_P(adr + 12);
00368       fail = ((BYTE) INP(adr + 6)) & 0x20;      // going to test!
00369       if (fail)
00370          break;
00371       (*d)++;
00372    }
00373    /* Turn off the Q-mode for repeat until Q=1 in the INPW(adr+12) */
00374    OUTP(adr + 1, 0x0);
00375 }

00377 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00378 
00379 INLINE void cam16i_sa(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f,
00380                       WORD ** d, const int r)
00381 {
00382    WORD adr, i;
00383 
00384    if (gbl_sw1d[c]) {
00385       adr = io_base[c >> 2] + ((c % 3) << 4);
00386       /* enable auto increment */
00387       OUTP_P(adr + 10, 49);
00388       OUTP(adr + 8, n);
00389       OUTP(adr + 6, a - 1);
00390       OUTP_P(adr + 10, f);
00391       INPW_P(adr + 12);
00392 
00393       for (i = 0; i < r; i++)
00394          *((*d)++) = INPW_P(adr + 12);  /* read data and trigger next cycle */
00395 
00396       /* disable auto increment */
00397       OUTP_P(adr + 10, 48);
00398    } else
00399       for (i = 0; i < r; i++)
00400          cami(c, n, a + i, f, (*d)++);
00401 }
00402 
00403 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00404 
00405 INLINE void cam24i_sa(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f,
00406                       DWORD ** d, const int r)
00407 {
00408    WORD adr, i;
00409 
00410    if (gbl_sw1d[c]) {
00411       adr = io_base[c >> 2] + ((c % 3) << 4);
00412 
00413       /* enable auto increment */
00414       OUTP_P(adr + 10, 49);
00415       OUTP(adr + 8, n);
00416       OUTP(adr + 6, a - 1);
00417       OUTP_P(adr + 10, f);
00418       INPW_P(adr + 12);
00419       for (i = 0; i < r; i++) {
00420          /* read data and trigger next cycle */
00421          *(((BYTE *) * d) + 2) = INP(adr + 4);
00422          *(((BYTE *) * d) + 3) = 0;
00423          *((WORD *) * d) = INPW_P(adr + 12);
00424          (*d)++;
00425       }
00426 
00427       /* disable auto increment */
00428       OUTP_P(adr + 10, 48);
00429    } else
00430       for (i = 0; i < r; i++)
00431          cam24i(c, n, a + i, f, (*d)++);
00432 }

00438 {
00439    int i;
00440 
00441    for (i = 0; i < r; i++)
00442       cam16i(c, n + i, a, f, (*d)++);
00443 }

00458 INLINE void cam8o(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f, BYTE d)
00459 {
00460    unsigned int adr;
00461 
00462    adr = io_base[c >> 2] + ((c % 3) << 4);
00463    OUTP(adr + 8, n);
00464    OUTP(adr, d);
00465    OUTP(adr + 6, a);
00466    OUTP(adr + 10, f);
00467 }

00469 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00470 
00471 INLINE void camo(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f, WORD d)
00472 {
00473    unsigned int adr;
00474 
00475    adr = io_base[c >> 2] + ((c % 3) << 4);
00476 
00477    OUTP(adr + 8, n);
00478    OUTP(adr, (BYTE) d);
00479    OUTP(adr + 2, *(((BYTE *) & d) + 1));
00480    OUTP(adr + 6, a);
00481    OUTP(adr + 10, f);
00482 }

00493 INLINE void cam24o(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f, DWORD d)
00494 {
00495    unsigned int adr;
00496 
00497    adr = io_base[c >> 2] + ((c % 3) << 4);
00498    OUTP(adr + 8, n);
00499    OUTP(adr, (BYTE) d);
00500    OUTP(adr + 2, *(((BYTE *) & d) + 1));
00501    OUTP(adr + 4, *(((BYTE *) & d) + 2));
00502    OUTP(adr + 6, a);
00503    OUTP(adr + 10, f);
00504 }

00508 INLINE void cam16o_q(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f,
00509                      WORD d, int *x, int *q)
00510 {
00511    unsigned int adr, status;
00512 
00513    adr = io_base[c >> 2] + ((c % 3) << 4);
00514    OUTP(adr + 8, n);
00515    OUTP(adr, (BYTE) d);
00516    OUTP(adr + 2, *(((BYTE *) & d) + 1));
00517    OUTP(adr + 6, a);
00518    OUTP(adr + 10, f);
00519 
00520    status = (BYTE) INP(adr + 6);
00521    *q = status & 1;
00522    *x = status >> 7;
00523 }

00536    OUTP(adr + 4, *(((BYTE *) & d) + 2));
00537    OUTP(adr + 6, a);

00546 
00547 INLINE void cam8o_r(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f,
00548                     BYTE * d, const int r)
00549 {
00550    WORD adr, i;
00551 
00552    adr = io_base[c >> 2] + ((c % 3) << 4);
00553 
00554    /* trigger first cycle */
00555    OUTP(adr + 8, n);
00556    OUTP(adr, *((BYTE *) d));
00557    OUTP(adr + 6, a);
00558    OUTP(adr + 10, f);
00559 
00560    for (i = 0; i < r - 1; i++)
00561       OUTPW(adr + 12, (BYTE) * (++d));  /* write data and trigger next cycle */
00562 }
00563 
00564 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00565 
00566 INLINE void cam16o_r(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f,
00567                      WORD * d, const int r)
00568 {
00569    WORD adr, i;
00570 
00571    adr = io_base[c >> 2] + ((c % 3) << 4);
00572 
00573    /* trigger first cycle */
00574    OUTP(adr + 8, n);
00575    OUTP(adr, *((BYTE *) d));
00576    OUTP(adr + 2, *(((BYTE *) d) + 1));
00577    OUTP(adr + 6, a);
00578    OUTP(adr + 10, f);
00579 
00580    for (i = 0; i < r - 1; i++)
00581       OUTPW(adr + 12, *(++d));  /* write data and trigger next cycle */
00582 }

00584 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00585 
00586 INLINE void cam24o_r(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f,
00587                      DWORD * d, const int r)
00588 {
00589    WORD adr, i;
00590 
00591    adr = io_base[c >> 2] + ((c % 3) << 4);
00592 
00593    /* trigger first cycle */
00594    OUTP(adr + 8, n);
00595    OUTP(adr, *((BYTE *) d));
00596    OUTP(adr + 2, *(((BYTE *) d) + 1));
00597    OUTP(adr + 4, *(((BYTE *) d) + 2));
00598    OUTP(adr + 6, a);
00599    OUTP(adr + 10, f);
00600 
00601    for (i = 0; i < r - 1; i++) {
00602       d++;
00603       OUTP(adr + 4, *(((BYTE *) d) + 2));
00604       OUTPW(adr + 12, (WORD) * d);      /* write data and trigger next cycle */
00605    }
00606 }
00607 
00608 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00609 
00610 INLINE int camc_chk(const int c)
00611 {
00612    unsigned int adr, n, a, f;
00613 
00614    /* clear inhibit */
00615    camc(c, 1, 2, 32);
00616 
00617    /* read back naf */
00618    adr = io_base[c >> 2] + ((c % 3) << 4);
00619    a = (BYTE) INP(adr + 10);
00620    n = (BYTE) INP(adr + 10);
00621    f = (BYTE) INP(adr + 10);
00622 
00623    if (n != 1 || a != 2 || f != 32)
00624       return -1;
00625 
00626    return 0;
00627 }
00628 
00629 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00630 
00631 INLINE void camc(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f)
00632 {
00633    unsigned int adr;
00634 
00635    adr = io_base[c >> 2] + ((c % 3) << 4);
00636    OUTP(adr + 8, n);
00637    OUTP(adr + 6, a);
00638    OUTP(adr + 10, f);
00639 }
00640 
00641 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00642 
00643 INLINE void camc_q(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f, int *q)
00644 {
00645    unsigned int adr, status;
00646 
00647    adr = io_base[c >> 2] + ((c % 3) << 4);
00648    OUTP(adr + 8, n);
00649    OUTP(adr + 6, a);
00650    OUTP(adr + 10, f);
00651 
00652    status = (BYTE) INP(adr + 6);
00653    *q = status & 1;
00654 }
00655 
00656 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00657 
00658 INLINE void camc_sa(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f, const int r)
00659 {
00660    int i;
00661 
00662    for (i = 0; i < r; i++)
00663       camc(c, n, a + i, f);
00664 }
00665 
00666 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00667 
00668 INLINE void camc_sn(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f, const int r)
00669 {
00670    int i;
00671 
00672    for (i = 0; i < r; i++)
00673       camc(c, n + i, a, f);
00674 }

00678 INLINE void cam_inhibit_set(const int c)
00679 {
00680    unsigned int adr;
00681 
00682    adr = io_base[c >> 2] + ((c % 3) << 4);
00683    OUTP(adr + 10, 33);
00684 }
00685

00688 INLINE void cam_inhibit_clear(const int c)
00689 {
00690    unsigned int adr;
00691 
00692    adr = io_base[c >> 2] + ((c % 3) << 4);
00693    OUTP(adr + 10, 32);
00694 }
00695 
00696 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00697 
00698 INLINE int cam_inhibit_test(const int c)
00699 {
00700    unsigned int adr;
00701    BYTE status;
00702 
00703    adr = io_base[c >> 2] + ((c % 3) << 4);
00704    status = (BYTE) INP(adr + 6);
00705    return (status & 1) > 0;
00706 }

00711 {

00713 
00714    adr = io_base[c >> 2] + ((c % 3) << 4);
00715    OUTP(adr + 10, 36);
00716 }
00717

00720 INLINE void cam_crate_zinit(const int c)
00721 {
00722    unsigned int adr;
00723 
00724    adr = io_base[c >> 2] + ((c % 3) << 4);
00725    OUTP(adr + 10, 34);
00726 }
00727 
00728 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00729 
00730 INLINE void cam_lam_enable(const int c, const int n)
00731 {
00732    /* enable the station number */
00733    unsigned int adr;
00734 
00735    /* enable LAM in controller */
00736    adr = io_base[c >> 2] + ((c % 3) << 4);
00737    OUTP(adr + 10, 64 + n);
00738 }
00739 
00740 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00741 
00742 INLINE void cam_lam_disable(const int c, const int n)
00743 {
00744    /* disable the station number */
00745    unsigned int adr;
00746 
00747    /* disable LAM in controller */
00748    adr = io_base[c >> 2] + ((c % 3) << 4);
00749    OUTP(adr + 10, 128 + n);
00750 }
00751 
00752 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00753 
00754 INLINE void cam_interrupt_enable(const int c)
00755 {
00756    unsigned int adr;
00757 
00758    /* enable interrupts in controller */
00759    adr = io_base[c >> 2] + ((c % 3) << 4);
00760    OUTP(adr + 10, 41);
00761 }
00762 
00763 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00764 
00765 INLINE void cam_interrupt_disable(const int c)
00766 {
00767    unsigned int adr;
00768 
00769    /* disable interrupts in controller */
00770    adr = io_base[c >> 2] + ((c % 3) << 4);
00771    OUTP(adr + 10, 40);
00772 }
00773 
00774 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00775 
00776 INLINE int cam_interrupt_test(const int c)
00777 {
00778    unsigned int adr;
00779    BYTE status;
00780 
00781    adr = io_base[c >> 2] + ((c % 3) << 4);
00782    status = (BYTE) INP(adr + 6);
00783    return (status & (1 << 2)) > 0;
00784 }
00785 
00786 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00787 
00788 INLINE void cam_lam_read(const int c, DWORD * lam)
00789 {
00790    /*
00791       return a BITWISE coded station NOT the station number
00792       i.e.: n = 5  ==> lam = 0x10
00793     */
00794    unsigned int adr, csr;
00795 
00796    adr = io_base[c >> 2] + ((c % 3) << 4);
00797    csr = (BYTE) INP(adr + 6);
00798    if (csr & (1 << 3)) {
00799       *lam = ((BYTE) INP(adr + 8)) & 0x1F;      // mask upper 3 bits
00800       *lam = 1 << (*lam - 1);
00801    } else
00802       *lam = 0;
00803 }
00804 
00805 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00806 
00807 INLINE void cam_lam_clear(const int c, const int n)
00808 {
00809    unsigned int adr;
00810 
00811    /*
00812       note that the LAM flip-flop in unit must be cleared via
00813 
00814       camc(c, n, 0, 10);
00815 
00816       in the user code prior to the call of cam_lam_clear()
00817     */
00818 
00819    /* restart LAM scanner in controller */
00820    adr = io_base[c >> 2] + ((c % 3) << 4);
00821    INP(adr + 8);
00822 }
00823

00826 INLINE int cam_init_rpc(char *host_name, char *exp_name, char *fe_name,
00827                         char *client_name, char *rpc_server)
00828 {
00829    /* dummy routine for compatibility */
00830    return 1;
00831 }
00832 
00833 /*---- DirectIO functions ------------------------------------------*/
00834 
00835 int directio_give_port(DWORD start, DWORD end)
00836 {
00837 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00838 
00839    /* under Windows NT, use DirectIO driver to open ports */
00840 
00841    OSVERSIONINFO vi;
00842    HANDLE hdio = 0;
00843    DWORD buffer[] = { 6, 0, 0, 0 };
00844    DWORD size;
00845 
00846    vi.dwOSVersionInfoSize = sizeof(OSVERSIONINFO);
00847    GetVersionEx(&vi);
00848 
00849    /* use DirectIO driver under NT to gain port access */
00850    if (vi.dwPlatformId == VER_PLATFORM_WIN32_NT) {
00851       hdio = CreateFile("\\\\.\\directio", GENERIC_READ, FILE_SHARE_READ, NULL,
00852                         OPEN_EXISTING, 0, NULL);
00853       if (hdio == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) {
00854          printf("hyt1331.c: Cannot access IO ports (No DirectIO driver installed)\n");
00855          return -1;
00856       }
00857 
00858       /* open ports */
00859       buffer[1] = start;
00860       buffer[2] = end;
00861       if (!DeviceIoControl(hdio, (DWORD) 0x9c406000, &buffer, sizeof(buffer),
00862                            NULL, 0, &size, NULL))
00863          return -1;
00864    }
00865 
00866    return 0;
00867 
00868 #elif defined(__linux__)
00869 
00870    /*
00871       In order to access the IO ports of the CAMAC interface, one needs
00872       to call the ioperm() function for those ports. This requires root
00873       privileges. For normal operation, this is performed by the "dio"
00874       program, which is a "setuid" program having temporarily root privi-
00875       lege. So the user program is started with "dio <program>". Since the
00876       program cannot be debugged through the dio program, we suplly here
00877       the direct ioperm call which requires the program to be run as root,
00878       making it possible to debug it. The program has then to be compiled
00879       with "gcc -DDO_IOPERM -o <program> <program>.c hyt1331.c ..."
00880     */
00881 
00882 #ifdef DO_IOPERM
00883 
00884    if (end <= 0x3FF) {
00885       if (ioperm(start, end - start + 1, 1) < 0) {
00886          printf("hyt1331.c: Cannot call ioperm() (no root privileges)\n");
00887          return -1;
00888       }
00889    } else {
00890       if (iopl(3) < 0) {
00891          printf("hyt1331.c: Cannot call iopl() (no root privileges)\n");
00892          return -1;
00893       }
00894    }
00895 
00896 #endif
00897 
00898    return 0;
00899 
00900 #else
00901 #error This driver cannot be compiled under this operating system
00902 #endif
00903 }
00904 
00905 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00906 
00907 int directio_lock_port(DWORD start, DWORD end)
00908 {
00909 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00910 
00911    /* under Windows NT, use DirectIO driver to lock ports */
00912 
00913    OSVERSIONINFO vi;
00914    HANDLE hdio;
00915    DWORD buffer[] = { 7, 0, 0, 0 };
00916    DWORD size;
00917 
00918    vi.dwOSVersionInfoSize = sizeof(OSVERSIONINFO);
00919    GetVersionEx(&vi);
00920 
00921    /* use DirectIO driver under NT to gain port access */
00922    if (vi.dwPlatformId == VER_PLATFORM_WIN32_NT) {
00923       hdio = CreateFile("\\\\.\\directio", GENERIC_READ, FILE_SHARE_READ, NULL,
00924                         OPEN_EXISTING, 0, NULL);
00925       if (hdio == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) {
00926          printf("hyt1331.c: Cannot access IO ports (No DirectIO driver installed)\n");
00927          return -1;
00928       }
00929 
00930       /* lock ports */
00931       buffer[1] = start;
00932       buffer[2] = end;
00933       if (!DeviceIoControl(hdio, (DWORD) 0x9c406000, &buffer, sizeof(buffer),
00934                            NULL, 0, &size, NULL))
00935          return -1;
00936    }
00937 
00938    return 0;
00939 
00940 #elif defined(__linux__)
00941 
00942 #ifdef DO_IOPERM
00943 
00944    if (end <= 0x3FF) {
00945       if (ioperm(start, end - start + 0, 0) < 0) {
00946          printf("hyt1331.c: Cannot call ioperm() (no root privileges)\n");
00947          return -1;
00948       }
00949    } else {
00950       if (iopl(0) < 0) {
00951          printf("hyt1331.c: Cannot call iopl() (no root privileges)\n");
00952          return -1;
00953       }
00954    }
00955 
00956 #endif
00957 
00958    return 0;
00959 
00960 #endif
00961 }
00962 
00963 /*---- PCI Scan ----------------------------------------------------*/
00964 
00965 int pci_scan(int vendor_id, int device_id, int n_dev, BYTE * pirq, DWORD * ba)
00966 {
00967 #ifdef __linux__
00968 
00969    FILE *f;
00970    char line[1000];
00971    int n;
00972    DWORD base_addr[6], irq, dfn, vend, vend_id, dev_id;
00973 
00974    f = fopen("/proc/bus/pci/devices", "r");
00975    if (f == NULL)
00976       return 0;
00977 
00978    n = 0;
00979    while (fgets(line, sizeof(line), f)) {
00980       sscanf(line, "%x %x %x %lx %lx %lx %lx %lx %lx",
00981              &dfn,
00982              &vend,
00983              &irq,
00984              &base_addr[0],
00985              &base_addr[1], &base_addr[2], &base_addr[3], &base_addr[4], &base_addr[5]);
00986 
00987       vend_id = vend >> 16U;
00988       dev_id = vend & 0xFFFF;
00989 
00990       /*
00991          printf("%x:%x %d %x %x %x %x\n", vend_id, dev_id, *irq, base_addr[0], base_addr[1],
00992          base_addr[2], base_addr[3]);
00993        */
00994 
00995       if (vend_id == vendor_id && dev_id == device_id)
00996          n++;
00997 
00998       if (n == n_dev)
00999          break;
01000    }
01001 
01002    fclose(f);
01003 
01004    if (n == n_dev) {
01005       *pirq = irq;
01006       memcpy(ba, base_addr, sizeof(base_addr));
01007       return 1;
01008    }
01009 
01010    return 0;
01011 
01012 #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
01013 
01014    DWORD buffer[] = { 8, 0, 0, 0 };
01015    DWORD retbuf[7];
01016    HANDLE hdio;
01017    int size;
01018 
01019    hdio = CreateFile("\\\\.\\directio", GENERIC_READ, FILE_SHARE_READ, NULL,
01020                      OPEN_EXISTING, 0, NULL);
01021    if (hdio == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) {
01022       printf("hyt1331.c: Cannot access DirectIO driver\n");
01023       return -1;
01024    }
01025 
01026    buffer[1] = vendor_id;
01027    buffer[2] = device_id;
01028    buffer[3] = n_dev + 1;
01029    if (!DeviceIoControl(hdio, (DWORD) 0x9c406000, &buffer, sizeof(buffer),
01030                         retbuf, sizeof(retbuf), &size, NULL))
01031       return 0;
01032 
01033    if (size == 0)
01034       return 0;
01035 
01036    *pirq = (BYTE) retbuf[0];
01037    memcpy(ba, retbuf + 1, sizeof(DWORD) * 6);
01038    return 1;
01039 
01040 #endif
01041 }
01042 
01043 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01044 
01045 void catch_sigsegv(int signo)
01046 {
01047    printf
01048        ("Cannot access ports. Please run with \"dio <prog>\" or compile with \"-DDO_IOPERM\"\n");
01049    signal(SIGSEGV, SIG_DFL);
01050 }
01051 
01052 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01053 
01054 INLINE int cam_init(void)
01055 {
01056    BYTE status, n_dev, i, n, a, f;
01057    WORD isa_io_base[] = { 0x200, 0x280, 0x300, 0x380 };
01058    WORD base_test;
01059    DWORD base_addr[6];
01060 
01061    /* set signal handler for segmet violation */
01062    signal(SIGSEGV, catch_sigsegv);
01063 
01064    /* scan PCI cards */
01065    for (n_dev = 0;; n_dev++) {
01066       if (!pci_scan(0x1196, 0x5331, n_dev + 1, irq + n_dev, base_addr))
01067          break;
01068 
01069       io_base[n_dev] = (WORD) (base_addr[3] & (~0x3UL));
01070 
01071       printf("hyt1331.c: Found PCI card at 0x%X, IRQ %d\n", io_base[n_dev], irq[n_dev]);
01072 
01073       if (directio_give_port(io_base[n_dev], io_base[n_dev] + 4 * 0x10) < 0) {
01074          signal(SIGSEGV, SIG_DFL);
01075          return 0;
01076       } else {
01077          n_dev++;
01078          break;                 // currently only supports one PCI interface
01079       }
01080    }
01081 
01082    /* scan ISA cards */
01083    for (i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
01084       base_test = isa_io_base[i];
01085 
01086       if (directio_give_port(base_test, base_test + 4 * 0x10) < 0) {
01087          signal(SIGSEGV, SIG_DFL);
01088          return 0;
01089       }
01090 
01091       /* Test if address is writable */
01092       OUTP(base_test, 0);
01093       status = INP(base_test);
01094       if (status != 0) {
01095          directio_lock_port(base_test, base_test + 4 * 0x10);
01096          continue;
01097       }
01098 
01099       /* Test A,N,F readback of ISA card */
01100       OUTP(base_test + 8, 1);
01101       OUTP(base_test + 6, 2);
01102       OUTP(base_test + 10, 32);
01103 
01104       a = (BYTE) INP(base_test + 10);
01105       n = (BYTE) INP(base_test + 10);
01106       f = (BYTE) INP(base_test + 10);
01107 
01108       if (n != 1 || a != 2 || f != 32) {
01109          directio_lock_port(base_test, base_test + 4 * 0x10);
01110          continue;
01111       }
01112 
01113       /* ISA card found */
01114       printf("hyt1331.c: Found ISA card at 0x%X\n", base_test);
01115 
01116       io_base[n_dev++] = base_test;
01117    }
01118 
01119    if (n_dev == 0) {
01120       printf("hyt1331.c: No PCI or ISA cards found\n");
01121       signal(SIGSEGV, SIG_DFL);
01122       return 0;
01123    }
01124 
01125    /* open port 80 for delayed write */
01126    directio_give_port(0x80, 0x80);
01127 
01128    /* check if we have access */
01129    OUTP(io_base[0], 0);
01130    signal(SIGSEGV, SIG_DFL);
01131 
01132    /* test auto increment switch SW1D */
01133    for (i = 0; i < n_dev; i++) {
01134       status = INP(io_base[i] + 6);
01135       if (!(status & (1 << 6))) {
01136          gbl_sw1d[i] = 0;
01137       } else {
01138          gbl_sw1d[i] = 1;
01139       }
01140    }
01141 
01142    return SUCCESS;
01143 }
01144 
01145 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01146 
01147 INLINE void cam_exit(void)
01148 {
01149    int i;
01150 
01151    /* lock IO ports */
01152    for (i = 0; i < MAX_DEVICES; i++)
01153       if (io_base[i])
01154          directio_lock_port(io_base[i], io_base[i] + 4 * 0x10);
01155 }
